abstracts.cdata!:
The Health Project will assist the
            Government of Niger in introducing policy reform in the
            health sector. It will assist in the implementation of
            Niger's Structural Adjustment Program at the sectoral
            level through studies and reform programs aimed at
            improvements in investment planning, the allocation of
            recurrent expenditures, cost recovery, the availability of
            essential drugs, and sector management aid coordination. It
            will also assist the Government to define policies relating
            to population and family planning and nutrition. Moreover,
            in support of the sectoral reform program, the project will
            improve the efficiency of priority health programs: (i)
            maternal and child health care including family planning,
            control of malaria, diarrhea and other communicable
            diseases, (ii) health education and community initiatives in
            health and nutrition, and (iii) training of health personnel.
